text: As the broadcast networks plan their schedules for the next TV season, the axes come out and hard choices must be made. Renewals and cancellations season can bring sad losses and consternation — like Fox cancelling Lucifer and canceling Brooklyn Nine - Nine, and then announcing a revival of the canceled ABC comedy Last Man Standing. But it can also bring unexpected delights, like ABC renewing Black - ish and NBC swooping in a few days after Brooklyn Nine - Nine ’ s cancellation to pick it up for a sixth season on that network. This year, the networks — ABC, CBS, NBC, Fox, and The CW — have been quick to announce their decisions, so we already have a good idea of which shows will thrive, barely survive, or die.
